See also: chef, chèf, and chef-

German[edit]

German Wikipedia has an article on:
Chef
Wikipedia de

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from French chef. Compare English chief and Spanish jefe.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): [ʃɛf]
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Chef m (genitive Chefs, plural Chefs, female Chefin)

  1. boss, chief

Derived terms[edit]

  • Al-Kaida-Chef
  • Chefin
  • Chefkoch
  • Chefredakteur
  • Chefetage
  • CDU-Chef
  • Fraktionschef
  • Klubchef
  • Küchenchef
  • Regierungschef
  • SPD-Chef
  • Taliban-Chef
  • Vorstandschef

Further reading[edit]

  • Chef in Duden online

Luxembourgish[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from French chef.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ʃæf/

Noun[edit]

Chef m (plural Cheffen, feminine Cheffin)

  1. boss, head, manager
